text: Chaulnes is a commune in the Somme department in Hauts-de-France in northern France. ==Geography== ==Demography== ==Culture== Chaulnes is noted for its cultural events, especially the heavy metal music festival Chaulnes Metal Fest (previously known as Killer Fest before 2008). Each year, more than 500 fans turn up to see and listen to bands like Obituary, Sodom, Rage or Nashville Pussy. ==Personalities== * Charles François Lhomond, grammarian and wit, born at Chaulnes 1727, died in Paris 1794. * The duchy of Chaulnes was established in 1621 for the Albert family. ==Places and monuments== * The statue of grammarian Lhomond, sculpted by Eugène-Louis Lequesne, in 1860, paid for by public subscription.. ==See also== *Communes of the Somme department *Réseau des Bains de Mer ==References== ==External links== * Chaulnes on the website of l'Institut géographique national * L'histoire Chaulnes (plain text) * Chaulnes on a French map Category:Communes of Somme (department)
title: Chaulnes
